name: Verbal Self-Defense
description: Mastering the art of linguistic self-defense to neutralize manipulation, gaslighting, and coercive control.

cards.title: Breaking Conversational Control
cards.description: Tactics to dismantle control-driven dialogue and regain dominance.
bulletpoints: Interrupting pattern-based speech derails a manipulator’s script.
Answering a question with a question forces the aggressor into a defensive posture.
Pausing before responding disarms attempts to force reactive compliance.
cards.summaryText: Disrupt their script with interruptions, counter-questions, and deliberate pauses.

cards.title: Reversing Verbal Traps
cards.description: Techniques for countering verbal setups and logical distortions.
bulletpoints: Turning loaded questions back on the asker prevents forced confessions.
Recognizing false dichotomies avoids being cornered into binary choices.
Calling out contradictions in real-time disrupts manipulation attempts.
cards.summaryText: Spot the trap, reframe the question, and expose contradictions on the spot.

cards.title: The Art of Non-Response
cards.description: Using silence, deflection, and calculated ambiguity to avoid being trapped.
bulletpoints: Refusing to engage on a manipulator’s terms denies them control.
Strategic silence creates discomfort that forces them to reveal more.
Offering vague responses protects against psychological profiling.
cards.summaryText: Stay vague or silent so the manipulator wastes energy while you stay unhooked.
